definition: to overlook/to watch from above
variant of 瞰[kan4]
to look down from a height/to spy on sth
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]
as far as the eye can see
to lean on sth and gaze into the distance
to gaze into the distance
vast/extending into the distance
lit. the sun sets in Yanzi (idiom)/fig. the day is drawing to an end/the last days (of a person, a dynasty etc)
to visit places famous for their scenery
gullies/valleys
water and sky merge in one color (idiom)
to observe from afar/to look into the distance from a high place
remote and vast
mountains/a range of hills
summit
the peaks of a mountain range
boundless/vast/hazy (distant horizon)
to survey the scene from an elevated position

(last line of the poem 望岳 by Tang poet Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]) with one look I shall see all the smaller mountains down below (from the summit of Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1])/(fig.) awe-inspiring view from a very high place
